column4: I've just upgraded my Dell 1420 laptop to Hardy 8.04 and the sound no longer works. Anybody know how to fix it?
this morning, sound stopped working for me. I set every sound parameter to alsa, then had to restart to re-enable sound
davidd I will try a system reboot and see if that helps - I went to the Multimedia Selector and selected Alsa for both input and output
are there other things to set to alsa first?
I tried a reboot, as far as I can see I have everything set to Alsa, my sound card driver seems to be the same as the one used in Gutsy (same device name) but still no sound
have you tried to play sound from the soud configuration interface?
if you mean using the "Test" on the sound config dialog then yes, and it makes no sound
no kidding.  Makes Hardy kind of a bummer.
I'm sorry, but I can't help you. Rkj have you upgraded or installed from scratch?
upgraded from Gutsy. Sound was working fine before the "upgrade"
if it's of interest, the machine is a Dell Inspiron 1420
upgrade is not recommended. Maybe if you install from scratch it will work
upgrade not recommended?? If I install from scratch won't I have to reinstall every package too?
every package not installed by default for sure. But in my case, I never upgrade, only reinstall from scratch
I think maybe I will shell out the $250 for support from Canonical. I never could get all the other audio jacks such as external mic in to work with the previous versions either
your unlucky... for me it works better with linux than windows... :)
I don't mean to complain. I can get a year of support from Canonical for about the price of windows with no support, and windows generally doesn't work any better.
